Issues.Title: The ContextMenu of NotifyIcon Positioning Issue on Multi-Monitor Setup with Differing Scaling Factors
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description


The WinForm example displays two instances of the same window on two screens, and adds an icon to the notification area that, when right-clicked, pops up a menu for control. However, under different scaling factors at the same resolution, the menu that appears upon right-clicking often becomes incorrect.


This is the resolution and scaling settings for the two monitors, as well as a video demonstrating the issue when clicking on the notification icon.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/7485003/b9c106f8-b069-42ff-8133-377559b316f7)
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/7485003/89b1a9af-252d-4334-afaa-863f59834b3d)


This is the resolution and scaling settings for the two monitors, as well as a video demonstrating the issue when clicking on the notification icon.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/7485003/62fced96-700e-403e-976c-0e4920e94f6f

In the video, when I right-click the notification icon of the program, the menu pops up correctly the first time. However, upon clicking for the second time, the menu position becomes completely incorrect.


### Steps to reproduce

Set up two monitors, with scaling rate A set to 100% and B set to 125%. Launch the attached project on monitor A, then right-click on the icon in the system notification area. Repeated clicks will reproduce the issue.

[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/14880691/WinFormsApp1.zip)

Issues.Title: Mark ComNativeDescriptor-related code as RequiresUnreferencedCode
Issues.Body:
Addresses some warnings in a winforms app by propagating RUC to code related to ComNativeDescriptor.
The app still produces one related warning for dotnet/runtime's reference (by name) to ComNativeDescriptor, which I plan to address with a feature switch. The code path is not needed in the trimmed test app.

Issues.Title: Fix Few CodeQL Warnings
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes a few CodeQL warnings
- Add `NonSerializedAttribute` to explicitly indicate that pointers/handles are not being serialized ([ex](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1943327/?view=edit))
- Suppress [warning](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1845222/?view=edit) in `ResXSerializationBinder` as this is meant to redirect to .NET Framework type names, if we cannot do so we want to fall back to default binder
- Add more logic in BitmapBinderTest testing `BindToType` to ensure deserialized bitmap is equivalent to original
- Update `BitmapBinder` to avoid return null ([ex](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1931519/?view=edit))
- Change to use fluent assertions for `BitmapBinderTests`
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11164)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix Few CodeQL Warnings" (#11164)

Issues.Title: Add Analyzers/CodeFixes to guide implementing Custom Control Properties according to WinForms best practices
Issues.Body:
When we author Controls, Custom Controls or User Controls, we also introduce Properties. Whenever we introduce Properties, we need to be aware, that those Properties are the Interface for all sorts of Data, which might also be available already at Design Time. The Developer of a Control therefore always should ensure to implement a property according for Best Practice to avoid unnecessary Code Generation, accidental serialization of data into resource files or serialization of nested Object graphs, which cannot correctly roundtrip.

To this end, we want to introduce Analyzers to help guide this process:

- [ ] Make sure, Properties are attributed with the `DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute`
- [ ] Suggest implementing either a `DefaultValue` attribute or the methods `ShouldSerialize[PropertyName]` and `Reset[Propertyname]`.
- [ ] Check, if possible, in the context, for stock type converters for the respective types, the existence of custom type converters or alternatively for custom CodeDOMSerializers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add Analyzers/CodeFixes to guide implementing Custom Control Properties according to WinForms best practices" (#11161)

Issues.Title: Don't build DesignSurface tests in .NET product build
Issues.Body:
Related to https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/10779
Related to https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet/pull/86
Related to https://github.com/dotnet/installer/pull/19218

All files in `src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/**`, except for the project files, are under a non-OSS license and [cannot be in the dotnet product](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/main/Documentation/UnifiedBuild/VMR-Permissible-Sources.md#policy-1). This means that the files must be removed from the .NET product via cloaking (originally completed in https://github.com/dotnet/installer/pull/19218).

Since these tests will not be buildable in the .NET product due to the cloaking, we must add `<ExcludeFromDotNetBuild>true</ExcludeFromDotNetBuild>` to the project files.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11140)
